data.title: Selena ~ Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio
data.meta_description: March 31st, Marks the 10 anniversary of Selena's death. So in her memory I'm sharing with all of you her "Last Dance/Disco Medley".  The Vocals for this song were recorded Live at her Last Conce
data.text:
Post by Zetroc Rodama on

March 31st, Marks the 10 anniversary of Selena's death.

So in her memory I'm sharing with all of you her "Last Dance/Disco Medley".

The Vocals for this song were recorded Live at her Last Concert Feb. 26, 1995.

Selena

Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio (Medley)

(Paul Jabarra/Van McCoy/Donna Summer/Giorgio Moroder)

DPRO-11947

01. Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio (Medley) (Radio Edit)* 4:08

02. Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio (Extended Club Remix)** 6:11

03. Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio (Live)*** 4:15

04. Last Dance/The Hustle/On the Radio (Video)* 4:17

*Produced by A.B. Quintanilla III. Remixed by A.B. Quintanilla III & Chris Fonseca. Programming: Chris Fonseca & Cruz Martinez. Keyboards: Chris Fonseca, Cruz Marinez, & Johnny Saenz. Mix Engineer: Cesar Sogbe.

**Produced by A.B. Quintanilla III. Remixed by A.B. Quintanilla III & Chris Fonseca. Programming: Chris Fonseca. Keyboards: Chris Fonseca & Ricky Vela. Mix Engineer: Cesar Sogbe.

***Live Version recorded at the Houston Astrodome, Texas. Produced by A.B. Quintanilla III.

Post by daniel9 on

just wondering do u have the rest of the concert or ru going to save that to post on the 31st?

Post by ðŸ…³ðŸ…¸ðŸ†‚ðŸ…²ðŸ…¾ on

Thank you for posting the medley. I have been looking for it ever since it came out. It's an amazing song.

It's still so sad that she's no longer with us. :'(

Post by Twiloboy on

You are amazing. Thank you so much. Just a few days ago, I got out my cd/dvd of her greatest hits. Great stuff.

I hope that her last concert includes Coma La Flor. That was amazing live.

Peace,

Ben

Post by Spoken Word on

Good remixes - she also had some decent remixes from Morales and Tony Moran for "A Boy Like That" and "I'm Getting Used To You". I also think she had remixes out for is Is It The Beat? (Enamorada English Version)

Post by Zetroc Rodama on

Wow, I didn't know you guys liked Selena? I have the other promos for "I'm Getting Used To You", A Boy Like That", "Is It The Beat?", and "Techno Cumbia". All of them Have Remixes on them, it's amazing how a few of her songs have been Remixed. Selena herself said she thought the whole idea of Remixing songs was "Cool" how she could do a ballad and then have it Remixed and be all "Funky"... I'll post them ASAP today! :)

Post by Fool_4_Music on

Wow. I can't believe it's been 10 years since Selena passed. It doesn't seem that long ago. Thanks for posting this!

Post by Spoken Word on

Is It The Beat? and Techno Cumbia would be interesting to hear. I have the Brazilian Nut Re-Mix somewhere and always liked that. I didn't know there was a promo out of just that song. I've seen the Brazilian remix on a promo with Dreaming Of You before.

Post by Zetroc Rodama on

Yeah, the promo is "Techno Cumbia/Dreaming Of You". The promo I have is from Mexico, I'm uploading the songs right now...

Post by Spoken Word on

The new remix for Baila Esta Cumbia is out now. It's actually now called Baila Esta Kumbia and its remixed by the Kumbia Kings (her brother and his bandmates)

Post by strong4PMB! on

Hector said:

Wow!! Thanks so much for posting these. It's so hard to find them

Post by 620 Soul Train on

Thank you for sharing, I think my sister has my mini-broadcast of this song reaching number one on my personal chart in 1997. I have the single that I bought at Target as a bonus CD for buying the soundtrack the J.Lo movie "Selena". Rick Dees played this as an extra as well on his weekly top 40 show.

Post by Zetroc Rodama on

Cool!!! You know what, when this song was released I was in Junior High and I wanted the Remixes so much, and I didnt have the DJ connections that I do now. So I saved all of my money and bought the promo off of Ebay for $80 and after I sent the money I saw that Target was selling the Soundtrack with the promo as a bonus CD fo $14!!! And I had the worst case of buyers remorse and I tried getting my money back but I didnt but its all good. Now I have three of those promos, 1 Mexican Promo, 1 Red Vinyl, and the 1 I paid $80...
